Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2010 03:56PM cmz wrote: Hello Otter,  What a great and informative post.  I've read some of your other posts and they're excellent as well.  Sounds like, to balance out the PR-, you need a high degree of ER+ and a nice, low proliferation rate.  On my biopsy, I was 90%+ for ER and my MI was a 1 out of three.  I hope these things help to offest the PR disadvantage.  Hard to tell, I gues. Ragrdless, thanks for the explanation.  Much appreciated. cmz
Posts.Title: PR- and onctype dx cmz cmz

Posts.Content: cmz wrote: I'm 45 years old, had a mastectomy on 4/21 for IDC and DCIS.  I'm >90% ER+ and 100% PR-.  My onc tells me that being PR negative is suggestive of a more aggressive cancer, so I'm worried about its impact on my oncotype score.  Anyone out there PR-?  Can you tell me what your score was?    I'd really appreciate the info.  Dx 3/24/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
